definitions: a building equipped with machinery for grinding grain into flour
a factory or building equipped with machinery for manufacturing or processing
examples: The old water mill still grinds wheat for local farmers
Historic mills dot the countryside along the river
The paper mill employed half the town's workforce
Steel mills transformed raw ore into finished products

definitions: a series of actions or steps taken to achieve a particular result or prepare something
examples: Food processing ensures products are safe for consumption
The processing of applications takes approximately two weeks

definitions: a feeling or emotion about something or someone
a view or opinion held or expressed about something
examples: The poem expressed deep sentiment about lost love
Holiday cards convey warm sentiments to family and friends
Public sentiment turned against the proposed development
Market sentiment affects stock prices significantly

definitions: something that is presented or made available to others
a contribution or gift presented as an act of worship
examples: The restaurant's lunch offerings include several vegetarian options
The company expanded its product offerings to attract new customers
Worshippers brought offerings of fruit and flowers to the temple
The collection plate gathered offerings for charity

definitions: the art, science, or practice of creating images by recording light on a sensitive medium
examples: Digital photography revolutionized how we capture and share memories
She studied photography at the art institute

definitions: a flat round piece of metal used as money
examples: Ancient coins reveal much about past civilizations
She collected rare coins from around the world

definitions: a portable computer small enough to use on your lap
examples: Students bring laptops to class for taking notes
Her laptop battery lasted through the entire flight

definitions: the quality of being morally good or virtuous
the beneficial or nutritious element of something
examples: Her goodness shone through in acts of kindness
The story celebrated the triumph of goodness over evil
Preserve the natural goodness of fresh vegetables by steaming
The goodness of whole grains supports healthy digestion

definitions: a formal connection or association with an organization or group
examples: Her affiliation with the university spans three decades
Political affiliations can influence voting patterns

definitions: a flying insect that collects nectar and pollen and produces honey and wax
examples: Bees pollinate flowers as they gather nectar
The bee colony worked together to build their hive

definitions: a prayer asking for divine favor and protection
something that brings happiness, good fortune, or relief
examples: The priest gave his blessing to the newlyweds
Parents sought blessings for their children's future
The rain was a blessing after months of drought
Good health is truly life's greatest blessing

definitions: the act of coming down to earth or reaching the ground after flight
a level area at the top or between flights of stairs
examples: The pilot executed a smooth landing despite strong winds
The spacecraft's landing on Mars was broadcast worldwide
She paused on the landing before climbing the next flight
Boxes were stacked on the landing outside the apartment

definitions: the action of fixing or mending something that is damaged or broken
examples: The repair of the roof took three days to complete
Auto repair shops stay busy after winter storms

definitions: a state of anxiety and uncertainty over actual or potential problems
examples: Parents' worry about their children never truly ends
Financial worries kept him awake at night

definitions: a religious or solemn ceremony consisting of a series of established actions
examples: The morning ritual of coffee and newspaper brought comfort
Ancient rituals marked the changing of seasons

definitions: a large container for water used for washing the body
an act of washing one's whole body while immersed in water
examples: The antique bath had ornate claw feet
They installed a new bath during the renovation
A warm bath helps soothe sore muscles
She gives the baby a bath every evening

definitions: soft wet earth that forms when soil mixes with water
examples: Children love playing in mud after rain showers
The truck got stuck in deep mud on the trail

definitions: something that causes someone to remember something
examples: She set a reminder on her phone for the appointment
The photograph served as a reminder of happier times

definitions: the state of being owned by another person and forced to work without pay
examples: The abolition of slavery marked a turning point in history
Museums educate visitors about the horrors of slavery

definitions: a person who supervises workers or the work done by others
examples: The supervisor reviewed each employee's performance quarterly
New employees should report problems to their supervisor

definitions: the amount or number of something that can be measured or counted
examples: The recipe requires precise quantities of each ingredient
Large quantities of data need secure storage

definitions: international sporting competitions held every four years in summer and winter
examples: Athletes train for years to compete in the Olympics
The Olympics bring together nations in peaceful competition

definitions: a surface that lies at an angle to the horizontal
the degree of incline measured as rise over run
examples: Skiers descended the steep slope with caution
The gentle slope made for easy hiking
Engineers calculated the slope needed for proper drainage
The roof's slope prevents snow accumulation

definitions: a garment worn around the waist hanging down around the legs
examples: She wore a flowing skirt to the summer party
The school uniform included a pleated skirt

definitions: a socket in a wall for connecting electrical devices
a store that sells goods directly from the manufacturer
a means of expressing or releasing emotions or energy
examples: The outlet near the desk powers three devices
Electricians installed additional outlets in the kitchen
Designer outlet stores offer discounted prices
The outlet mall attracts bargain hunters
Exercise provides a healthy outlet for stress
Writing became her creative outlet

definitions: a piece of fabric hung to cover a window or divide a space
examples: Sunlight filtered through the sheer curtains
They drew the curtains for privacy in the evening

definitions: a formal or explicit statement or announcement of something
examples: The Declaration of Independence changed world history
She made a declaration of her intentions to the board

definitions: a device for making and breaking an electrical circuit
an act of changing from one thing to another
examples: The light switch is located beside the door
Safety switches prevent electrical accidents
The switch from analog to digital transformed communications
Making the switch to renewable energy takes planning

definitions: a system showing days, weeks, and months of a particular year
examples: Mark important dates on your calendar
The academic calendar runs from September to June

definitions: a distinct section of writing dealing with a single theme
examples: Each paragraph should focus on one main idea
The essay's opening paragraph grabbed readers' attention

definitions: a long or arduous search for something important
examples: The knight's quest for the holy grail became legendary
Scientists continue their quest for a cancer cure

definitions: having a level surface without raised areas or indentations
an apartment on one floor of a building
examples: The flat prairie stretched endlessly to the horizon
Make sure the table is completely flat before assembling
They rented a two-bedroom flat in the city center
The flat overlooked a beautiful park

definitions: a person who organizes and operates a business taking on financial risks
examples: The entrepreneur launched three successful startups
Young entrepreneurs drive innovation in technology

definitions: a stiff sticky earth that can be molded when wet and hardens when heated
examples: Artists shape clay into beautiful pottery
The soil contained too much clay for good drainage

definitions: twelve o'clock in the middle of the day
examples: The meeting is scheduled for noon tomorrow
The sun reaches its highest point at noon

definitions: the joint between the forearm and upper arm
examples: He bruised his elbow playing basketball
Rest your elbows on the table while eating

definitions: the state of being united or joined as a whole
examples: National unity strengthened during the crisis
The team showed remarkable unity in pursuing their goal

definitions: a regular payment made by a tenant to a landlord
a large tear or opening in fabric or material
examples: Monthly rent includes utilities and parking
Rent prices increased significantly in urban areas
The storm left a huge rent in the tent fabric
A rent in the sail needed immediate repair

definitions: a powered flying vehicle with fixed wings for air travel
examples: The airplane departed on time despite weather concerns
Modern airplanes can fly non-stop across oceans

definitions: a collection of work samples demonstrating skills and accomplishments
a range of investments held by a person or organization
examples: The artist's portfolio showcased her best paintings
Job applicants should bring portfolios to interviews
Her investment portfolio includes stocks and bonds
Diversifying your portfolio reduces financial risk

definitions: the direction or region between north and west
examples: Strong winds blow from the northwest in winter
They traveled northwest through mountain passes

definitions: moisture exuded through pores of the skin typically during physical exertion
examples: Sweat dripped from his forehead during the workout
The body produces sweat to regulate temperature

definitions: a collection of valuable objects such as gold, silver, or jewels
something valued highly for its worth or importance
examples: Pirates buried treasure on remote islands
The museum displays treasures from ancient civilizations
Children are every parent's greatest treasure
She treasured the handwritten letters from her grandmother

definitions: powder obtained by grinding grain, especially wheat
examples: Bread flour has higher protein content than cake flour
She measured two cups of flour for the recipe

definitions: a mass meeting of people for a political or other cause
a recovery or increase after a period of decline
examples: Thousands attended the rally for climate action
The campaign rally energized supporters
The stock market rally surprised many investors
The team's fourth-quarter rally secured victory

definitions: failure to fulfill an obligation, especially to repay a loan
a preselected option adopted when no alternative is specified
examples: Mortgage default rates increased during the recession
The company faces default on its bonds
The default settings work well for most users
Change the default font in your word processor

definitions: a large area of flat land with few trees
lacking decoration or ornamentation
examples: Buffalo once roamed the great plains in millions
The fertile plain supported extensive agriculture
She preferred plain clothing without patterns
Write in plain language everyone can understand

definitions: the action of traveling through an unfamiliar area to learn about it
examples: Space exploration pushes the boundaries of human knowledge
Early exploration of America changed world history

definitions: an arm or leg of a person or animal
a large branch of a tree
examples: The accident left him with a broken limb
Physical therapy helped strengthen her injured limb
The storm snapped several large limbs from the oak
Birds nested in the upper limbs of trees

definitions: a written document granting rights or privileges from a sovereign or government
the hiring of an aircraft, ship, or vehicle for private use
examples: The university operates under a royal charter
The charter established fundamental rights and freedoms
They arranged a charter flight for the team
Fishing charter boats leave the harbor at dawn
